title: Authors and Citation
text: Mike Johnson. Author, maintainer. Justin Singh-Mohudpur. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Johnson M, Singh-Mohudpur J (2025). hfutils: hfutils. R package version 0.3.3, https://github.com/lynker-spatial/hfutils.
code: @Manual{,   title = {hfutils: hfutils},   author = {Mike Johnson and Justin Singh-Mohudpur},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.3.3},   url = {https://github.com/lynker-spatial/hfutils}, }

title: hfutils
text: hfutils provides base utilities needed hydrofabric creation manipulation.

title: hfutils
text: can install development version hfutils GitHub :

title: hfutils
code: gpkg <- '/Users/mikejohnson/hydrofabric/v3.0/reference_fabric.gpkg' hfutils::as_ogr(gpkg) #> [1] "divides"        "flowpaths"      "hydrolocations" "pois"           #> [5] "network" #> <OGRSQLConnection> #>  DSN: /Users/mikejohnson/hydrofabric/v3.0/reference_fabric.gpkg... #> tables: divides, flowpaths, hydrolocations, pois, network

title: hfutils
hfutils
hfutils
hfutils
code: hfutils::as_ogr('/vsis3/lynker-spatial/hydrofabric/v2.2/conus/conus_nextgen.gpkg') #>  [1] "flowpaths"              "divides"                "lakes"                  #>  [4] "nexus"                  "pois"                   "hydrolocations"         #>  [7] "flowpath-attributes"    "flowpath-attributes-ml" "network"                #> [10] "divide-attributes" #> <OGRSQLConnection> #>  DSN: /vsis3/lynker-spatial/hydrofabric/v2.2/conus/conus_nextgen.gpkg #> tables: flowpaths, divides, lakes, nexus, pois, hydrolocations, flowpath-attributes, flowpath-attributes-ml, network, divide-attributes

title: hfutils
code: ## Accumulate Downstream system.time({   da <-  hfutils::as_ogr(gpkg,                           'flowpaths')  |>    filter(vpuid == "01") |>    st_as_sf() |>    accumulate_downstream(attr = "areasqkm")}) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.821   0.464   1.285  head(da) #> [1]  15.66720  11.12805   4.44600   6.52365   4.53420 335.51145  ## Hydrosequence system.time({   hs <-  hfutils::as_ogr(gpkg,                           'flowpaths')  |>    filter(vpuid == "01") |>    st_as_sf() |>    get_hydroseq() }) #>    user  system elapsed  #>   1.008   0.460   1.470  head(hs) #> [1]   804 22722 22724 22723 22725 28137

title: hfutils
text: Please reach via issue PR comments, concerns, questions!

title: OGRSQL OGRSQL driver, use to [dbConnect()] to a data source readable by sf — OGRSQL
Class OGRSQLConnection (and methods) — OGRSQLConnection-class
text: OGRSQLConnection objects created passing [OGRSQL()] first argument [DBI::dbConnect()]. superclass [DBIConnection-class] class.

title: Class OGRSQLConnection (and methods) — OGRSQLConnection-class
code: # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLConnection' show(object)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLConnection,ANY' dbSendQuery(conn, statement, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLConnection,character' dbReadTable(conn, name, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLConnection' dbListTables(conn, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLConnection,ANY' dbExistsTable(conn, name, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLConnection' dbDisconnect(conn, ...)

title: Class OGRSQLDriver — OGRSQLDriver-class
text: OGRSQLDriver objects created [OGRSQL()] used select correct method [dbConnect()]. superclass [DBIDriver-class] class, used purely dispatch.

title: Class OGRSQLDriver — OGRSQLDriver-class
code: # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLDriver,ANY' dbDataType(dbObj, obj, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLDriver' dbIsValid(dbObj, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLDriver' dbUnloadDriver(drv, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLDriver' dbGetInfo(dbObj, ...)

title: Class OGRSQLResult (and methods) — OGRSQLResult-class
text: OGRSQLResult objects created [dbSendQuery()] [dbSendStatement()], encapsulate result SQL statement. superclass [DBIResult-class] class. "Usage" section lists class methods overridden lazsf.

title: Class OGRSQLResult (and methods) — OGRSQLResult-class
code: # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLResult' show(object)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLResult' dbFetch(res, n = -1, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLResult' dbClearResult(res, ...)  # S4 method for class 'OGRSQLResult' dbHasCompleted(res, ...)

what: Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
title: Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
text: Propagates per-node attribute (e.g. area) downstream along `toid` links returns accumulated (upstream-summed) value input row. network must DAG (cycles). O(E) pass single topological sort fast large hydro networks.

title: Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
text: x data frame, tibble, sf object containing least identifier column given `id`, downstream pointer column given `toid`, attribute column named `attr`. id Character scalar. Column name `x` unique node identifiers. Defaults `"flowpath_id"`. toid Character scalar. Column name `x` *downstream* node identifier row. Use `NA` `0` outlets/terminals. Defaults `"flowpath_toid"`. attr Character scalar. Column name `x` containing attribute accumulate (e.g., `"incremental_areasqkm"`). Values coerced numeric.

title: Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
text: numeric vector length `nrow(x)` giving accumulated   totals aligned rows `x`.

title: Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
text: algorithm builds vertex set `id` non-missing `toid` values, performs topological sort (using igraph), processes edges nondecreasing topological order sources. edge `u -> v`, running total `u` added `v`. naturally handles confluences multiple upstream sources contribute downstream target. function treats `NA` `0` `toid` outlets. function stops error network contains cycles. Ensure graph acyclic (tree/DAG) calling.

title: Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
text: single neighbor-independent edge pass made topo sort, computations done integer indices. avoids per-vertex neighbor lookups scales well large hydrologic networks.

title: Accumulate an attribute downstream over a directed acyclic network — accumulate_downstream
code: # Toy: 1 -> 3, 2 -> 3, 3 -> 4 (two headwaters merging into 3, then into 4) df <- data.frame(   flowpath_id   = c(1, 2, 3, 4),   flowpath_toid = c(3, 3, 4, NA),   area           = c(1.0, 2.0, 0.5, 0.0) ) accumulate(df, id = "flowpath_id", toid = "flowpath_toid", attr = "area") #> Error in accumulate(df, id = "flowpath_id", toid = "flowpath_toid", attr = "area"): could not find function "accumulate" # Expected: node 1 stays 1.0, node 2 stays 2.0, # node 3 gets 1.0 + 2.0 + 0.5 = 3.5, node 4 gets 3.5 + 0.0 = 3.5

title: Compute km2 area — add_areasqkm
text: Safely compute area square kilometers (numeric vector) Safely compute polygon area km^2 return plain numeric vector.

title: Compute km2 area — add_areasqkm
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(sf) nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE) add_areasqkm(nc[1, ]) } # }

what: Delayed read for vector resources — as_ogr
title: Delayed read for vector resources — as_ogr
text: lazy data frame GDAL vector data sources. as_ogr DBI compatible designed work dplyr.

title: Delayed read for vector resources — as_ogr
code: as_ogr(x, layer, ..., query = NA, ignore_lyrs = "gpkg_|rtree_|sqlite_")  # S3 method for class 'character' as_ogr(x, layer, ..., query = NA, ignore_lyrs = "gpkg_|rtree_|sqlite_")  # S3 method for class 'OGRSQLConnection' as_ogr(x, layer, ..., query = NA, ignore_lyrs = "gpkg_|rtree_|sqlite_")

title: Delayed read for vector resources — as_ogr
text: x data source (file path, url, database connection) layer layer name (varies driver, may file name without extension); case layer missing, st_read read first layer dsn, give warning (unless quiet = TRUE) print message multiple layers, give error layers dsn. dsn database connection, layer can table name database identifier (see Id). also possible omit layer rather use query argument. ... parameter(s) passed st_as_sf query SQL query pass directly ignore_lyrs pattern layers ignored description

title: Delayed read for vector resources — as_ogr
text: 'tbl_OGRSQLConnection'

title: Delayed read for vector resources — as_ogr
text: output `as_ogr()` 'tbl_OGRSQLConnection` extends `tbl_dbi` may used functions workflows normal DBI way, see [OGRSQL()] as_ogr DBI support. obtain memory data frame use explict `collect()` `st_as_sf()`. call `collect()` triggered `st_as_sf()` add sf class output.

title: Clean Catchment Geometry — clean_geometry
text: Fix common geometry issues DEM-derived catchments (disjoint fragments, artifacts, invalid topologies) optionally apply topology- preserving simplification via mapshaper. `flowlines` provided, largest part per catchment chosen preferentially touches corresponding flowline feature.

title: Clean Catchment Geometry — clean_geometry
code: clean_geometry(   catchments,   flowlines = NULL,   fl_ID = NULL,   ID = "ID",   keep = NULL,   crs = 5070,   grid = 9e-04,   gb = 8,   force = FALSE,   sys = NULL )

title: Clean Catchment Geometry — clean_geometry
text: catchments sf POLYGON/MULTIPOLYGON unique ID column. flowlines optional sf LINESTRING/MULTILINESTRING picking "prime" part per catchment (largest piece intersects flowline). fl_ID character. Unique identifier column `flowlines` matches `ID` `catchments`. ID character. Unique identifier column `catchments`. Default: "ID". keep numeric (0,1]. Proportion points retain simplification. `NULL`, simplification performed. Default: `NULL`. crs integer object accepted `sf::st_crs`. projected CRS suitable area calculations. Default: 5070 (NAD83 / Conus Albers). grid numeric. Snap--grid size (target CRS units). Default: 0.0009. gb integer. Heap GB `mapshaper-xl` `force = TRUE` `gb > 8`. Default: 8. force logical. Use system `mapshaper` / `mapshaper-xl` binaries directly simplification (faster robust large data). Default: FALSE. sys logical NULL. Use system mapshaper rmapshaper calls. NULL, auto-detect. Set env `TURN_OFF_SYS_MAPSHAPER=YUP` force `FALSE`.

what: Read Hydrofabric Layers from a GeoPackage (or accept in-memory `sf` objects) — read_hydrofabric
title: Read Hydrofabric Layers from a GeoPackage (or accept in-memory `sf` objects) — read_hydrofabric
text: Convenience reader Hydrofabric GeoPackage returns named list `sf` objects: `list(divides = ..., flowpaths = ...)`. may provide GeoPackage path let function auto-detect layer names, ** pass -memory `sf` objects directly. Optionally transforms target CRS harmonizes CRS across returned layers.

title: Read Hydrofabric Layers from a GeoPackage (or accept in-memory `sf` objects) — read_hydrofabric
code: read_hydrofabric(   gpkg = NULL,   divides = NULL,   flowpaths = NULL,   realization = c("all", "divides", "flowpaths"),   crs = NULL,   verbose = Sys.getenv("hydrofab_verbose") != "false" )

title: Read Hydrofabric Layers from a GeoPackage (or accept in-memory `sf` objects) — read_hydrofabric
text: gpkg Character path GeoPackage. `NULL`, function use `divides` /`flowpaths` arguments (provided). Default: `NULL`. divides Either `NULL`, character layer name within `gpkg`, -memory `sf` object representing divides/catchments. flowpaths Either `NULL`, character layer name within `gpkg`, -memory `sf` object representing flowpaths/flowlines. realization One `""`, `"divides"`, `"flowpaths"`. Controls layers auto-discover/read `gpkg` corresponding arguments `NULL`. Default: `""`. crs Optional CRS transform outputs (e.g., EPSG code like `5070`, `sf::crs` object, input accepted `sf::st_crs()`). verbose Logical; print progress messages. Default uses environment variable `hydrofab_verbose` (anything literal `"false"` treated verbose).

title: Read Hydrofabric Layers from a GeoPackage (or accept in-memory `sf` objects) — read_hydrofabric
text: named list two elements: `divides`: `sf` object (available) `flowpaths`: `sf` object (available)

title: Read Hydrofabric Layers from a GeoPackage (or accept in-memory `sf` objects) — read_hydrofabric
text: - `divides`/`flowpaths` provided -memory `sf` objects,   used -(subject optional CRS transformation). - `gpkg` provided corresponding layer argument : `NULL`: function tries auto-detect layer name. character: name used (validated). - Auto-discovery looks : Flowpaths: names matching `flowpath|flowline`, excluding       `attributes|edge_list`. Divides: names matching `divide|catchment`, excluding `network`. multiple candidates found, error thrown candidates listed. CRS behavior: - `crs` provided, returned layers transformed CRS. - Otherwise, two layers returned different CRSs, second   transformed CRS first.

title: Read Hydrofabric Layers from a GeoPackage (or accept in-memory `sf` objects) — read_hydrofabric
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Auto-detect layers from a HydroFabric GPKG and return both x <- read_hydrofabric("path/to/hydrofabric.gpkg")  # Read only flowpaths (auto-detected) and transform to EPSG:5070 x <- read_hydrofabric("path/to/hydrofabric.gpkg", realization = "flowpaths", crs = 5070)  # Supply in-memory sf layers (no gpkg), harmonize to EPSG:3857 x <- read_hydrofabric(divides = my_divides_sf, flowpaths = my_flow_sf, crs = 3857) } # }
